html.title: HTML Documentation
html.content:
## Introduction HTML (HyperText Markup Language) is the standard language for creating web pages. ## Elements HTML elements are the building blocks of a webpage. ### Paragraphs The `

` tag defines a paragraph in HTML. ### Headings HTML provides six levels of headings, from `

` to `

`. ## Attributes HTML attributes provide additional information about an element. ### Class and ID The `class` and `id` attributes are used to apply CSS styles and JavaScript behaviors.

css.title: CSS Documentation
css.content:
## Introduction
CSS (Cascading Style Sheets) is used to style HTML content.

## Selectors
Selectors are used to target elements in CSS.

### Class Selector
The class selector (`.classname`) targets elements with a specific class.

### ID Selector
The ID selector (`#idname`) targets elements with a specific ID.

## Properties
CSS properties define how elements appear.

### Color and Background
You can set colors using the `color` and `background-color` properties.

### Box Model
The box model consists of margins, borders, padding, and the actual content.

javascript.title: JavaScript Documentation
javascript.content:
## Introduction
JavaScript is a programming language used to create interactive web pages.

## Variables
Variables store data values in JavaScript.

### var, let, and const
- `var` is function-scoped.
- `let` and `const` are block-scoped.

## Functions
Functions allow you to reuse code.

### Function Declaration
A function can be declared using the `function` keyword.

### Arrow Functions
Arrow functions provide a shorter syntax for writing functions.
